hadiths.english_translation: Critical biography: Hakim ibn Jubair narrated from Said ibn Jubair and Ibrahim. Al-Thawri narrated from him. Shu'bah used to criticize him. Ahmad said that Waki' said: Ibn Hakim ibn Jubair said that his father was a mawla (client) of Banu Umayyah. Yahya and Ibn Mahdi would not narrate from him, nor from Abd al-A'la (al-Thalabi).

narrators.name: Hakim ibn Jubair
reliabilityIssues: rejected by Yahya ibn Ma'in and Ibn Mahdi

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever goes to a soothsayer and believes him in what he says, or goes to a menstruating woman, or goes to a woman in anal intercourse, has disassociated himself from what was revealed to Muhammad ﷺ.' The commentary states: 'This hadith is not corroborated [by others], and there is no known hearing for Abu Tamimah from Abu Hurayrah according to the Basrians.'

hadiths.english_translation: Biographical and critical commentary: He heard from Anas and Ibrahim. From him heard al-Thawri and Shu'bah. Abu Nu'aim said: He died in the year 120 AH, and he was a client (mawla) of the family of Abi Musa. Abu Ismail is his kunyan, given to him by Musa ibn Ismail. Sulayman ibn Harb said: [chain] Hammad ibn Zayd narrated to us from Shuayb ibn al-Habhab, he said: He heard Ibrahim say: 'This man has questioned me just as all the people questioned me' (meaning Hammad). Amr ibn Muhammad said: 'I heard Amr ibn Uthman say: I heard Ubayd Allah ibn Amr: Hammad ibn Abi Sulayman died in the year 119 AH.'
